title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
<msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <DarkKnightCZ> maven.xwiki.org down?  
07:59 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: maven.xwiki.org is incredibly slow, since CI isn't also available, i guess they're on the same server... maybe jenkins is stressing the CPU again?  
08:50 <vmassol> checking thanks  
08:50 <DarkKnightCZ> you're welcome  
08:53 <vmassol> should be better now  
08:56 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, still loading slowly  
08:56 <vmassol> yes it's slow again  
08:58 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <vmassol> better now?  
09:07 <vmassol> let's hope it holds ;)  
09:07 <DarkKnightCZ> yup :) jenkins?  
09:07 <vmassol> maven.xwiki.org and ci.xwiki.org are ok for me right now  
09:07 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, for me as well  
09:08 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
09:08 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <vmassol> good morning everyone, today is release day for 6.3M1! :)  
09:24 <vmassol> we're still missing a release manager though  
09:25 <vmassol> interesting: http://asciidoctor.org/docs/asciidoctor-diagram/ Seems aasciidoctor supports a sort of macros which will be useful once we have support for parsing it...  
09:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:45 <gdelhumeau> I am working on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/  
09:46 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <gdelhumeau> The WYSIWYG editor is not the default editor anymore?  
09:52 <gdelhumeau> apparently the conf have not changed  
09:52 <gdelhumeau> maybe it is related to the changes that Thomas have made on the wiki conf cache  
09:54 <vmassol> if it's not it's a regression  
09:54 <vmassol> in 6.2.2?  
09:54 <vmassol> in 6.3M1?  
09:55 <gdelhumeau> 6.3-SNAPSHOT  
09:57 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <gdelhumeau> hi tmortagne  
10:02 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: Hi  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> looking at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/ I am realized that when you click on "edit", the wysiwyg editor is not loaded but the wiki one is  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> -am +have  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> and even if the configuration says that the Wysiwyg editor is the default one  
10:04 <gdelhumeau> it might be related to your changes on the configuration cache, WDYT?  
10:04 <tmortagne> do you reproduce it ?  
10:04 <gdelhumeau> yep  
10:04 <tmortagne> is XE up to date ?  
10:04 <gdelhumeau> -SNAPSHOT  
10:04 <tmortagne> maybe it's missing some of the last commits  
10:05 <tmortagne> will try to reproduce locally with what's on master  
10:07 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: where is the configuration that is not taken into account in your case ?  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> Wiki Conf: default editor = WYSIWYG  
10:19 <tmortagne> also isn't the WYSIWYG the default editor when there is not configuration ?  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> Admin user conf: default editor = ''  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> when I edit a page, I have the wiki editor  
10:20 <tmortagne> you set these configuration ?  
10:20 <tmortagne> or do we have WYSIWYG by default in XWikiPReferences ?  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> no, it is the default one  
10:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I think the issue is that I forgot to copy the "---" means empty hack in the user configuration source  
10:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <tmortagne> looking at it  
10:48 <tmortagne> note that user configuration source is older that this hack O:-)  
10:59 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <vmassol> nice site to know about maven releases: http://blog.soebes.de/blog/categories/maven-plugin-releases/  
11:05 <vmassol> (maven plugin releases)  
11:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is also https://www.artifact-listener.org/ but http://blog.soebes.de/blog/categories/maven-plugin-releases/ gives the release note which is nicer  
11:11 <vmassol> yes the RN are nice  
11:50 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <polx> has quit  
12:11 <AFKGeek> has quit  
12:37 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <Lyes> has quit  
13:14 <Denis> has quit  
13:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <polx> has quit  
15:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:22 <silverdrop> has quit  
15:30 <polx> has quit  
15:34 <mflorea> tmortagne, vmassol: how can I prevent wiki syntax transformations at runtime?  
15:34 <mflorea> I just noticed that {{velocity wiki="false"}}\*\*foo\*\* (?){{/velocity}} executes to my surprise the icon transformation  
15:34 <mflorea> so I loose it with action=get and outputSyntax=plain  
15:34 <tmortagne> did not know icon transformation were enabled by default  
15:35 <vmassol> checking  
15:35 <mflorea> I did not enabled it  
15:36 <vmassol> hmm strange  
15:36 <vmassol> I see:  
15:36 <vmassol> if (parameters.isWiki()) {  
15:36 <vmassol>     result = parseSourceSyntax(content, context);  
15:36 <vmassol> so parseSource should only be called if wiki=true  
15:37 <vmassol> ah no, looking at the wrong place  
15:37 <vmassol> the macro doesn't do anything  
15:37 <vmassol> (the macro itself I mean)  
15:37 <vmassol> my bad  
15:37 <vmassol> that's why  
15:38 <vmassol> it's XWikiDocument.getRenderedContent() that calls the tx  
15:38 <mflorea> I see  
15:38 <tmortagne> but is that expected that icon transformation is enabled by default ?  
15:38 <vmassol> yes  
15:38 <mflorea> so you cannot block transformations from within wiki syntax?  
15:39 <vmassol> by default we have macro and icon AFAIK  
15:39 <mflorea> yes, just checked xwiki.properties  
15:39 <vmassol> #-# The default value is: macro, icon  
15:39 <vmassol> mflorea: indeed we cannot  
15:39 <vmassol> unless  
15:39 <vmassol> you wrap in some verbatim block  
15:40 <tmortagne> the way icon tx works you can't really disable it from the wiki content itself no, that's why  don't like it too much, best would be to have an icon syntax and an icon block  
15:40 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:41 <tmortagne> that way you can escape it like any other wiki element  
15:41 <vmassol> icon syntax is complex  
15:41 <vmassol> because it means parsing it at the wikimodel level  
15:41 <vmassol> and it means it cannot be dynamic  
15:41 <tmortagne> it's as dynamic as macros  
15:41 <vmassol> no  
15:41 <vmassol> because macros have a syntax  
15:42 <vmassol> oh you mean intriducing a special syntax  
15:42 <vmassol> so you wouldn't write:  
15:42 <vmassol> : )  
15:42 <vmassol> but you would write something like  
15:42 <vmassol> (: ))  
15:42 <vmassol> grr  
15:42 <vmassol> ( : ) )  
15:42 <vmassol> (extra spaces added)  
15:43 <msmeria> has quit  
15:43 <tmortagne> for the dynamic ones yes and we can always add a few shortcuts like :)  
15:45 <vmassol> another idea would be to have a NoTransformationBlock …  
15:46 <tmortagne> or indicate an explicit list of transformation for the document, if not set then the default list is used  
15:47 <vmassol> yes, or both, depending on the fine-graininess we need  
15:48 <vmassol> it should be easy to allow listing the txs to execute in the rendering context  
15:48 <tmortagne> in the rendering context yes  
16:17 <lucaa> has quit  
16:22 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:36 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <cjd> 97 requests | 5.4 MB transferred | 1.2 min (load: 1.0 min, DOMContentLoaded: 51.88 s)  
16:41 <cjd> (loading a wysiwyg page)  
16:41 <cjd> didn't expect it to download xwiki :(  
16:42 <tmortagne> yes the WYSYWYG is a big beast  
16:45 <cjd> wysiwyg's big file is 631 KB  
16:45 <cjd> 3 smartclient files are bigger  
17:05 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
17:11 <cjd> gdelhumeau: would it hurt to load the wysiwyg in an iframe?  
17:11 <cjd> re ie9fail  
17:12 <gdelhumeau> cjd: not a bad idea  
17:12 <gdelhumeau> but I wonder if it is doable or if it needs a lot of refactoring  
17:13 <cjd> yes and yes  
17:13 <cjd> http://realtime.webviewers.org/xwiki/bin/view/Demos/RTAdvancedWysiwyg  
17:13 <mflorea> cjd, the text area is already an iframe, why would want to include the menus and tools bar also?  
17:14 <cjd> because people get mad when IE9 craps itself with a SIGSEGV  
17:14 <mflorea> does it crash because of the menus or the toolbar?  
17:14 <gdelhumeau> not a segfault  
17:15 <cjd> some kind of interaction between the css and the wysiwyg afaik  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11206  
17:15 <cjd> oh you fixed the segfault  
17:15 <mflorea> if not, then the editor is already in an iframe, so I don't know what you mean by "load the wysiwyg in an iframe"  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> yeah, it was epic :)  
17:15 <cjd> "fixed" --> worked around  
17:16 <gdelhumeau> it seems that the bad div is .gwt-TabPanelBottom  
17:16 <cjd> would be epic to create a piece of css that crashes IE and you can paste in facebook  
17:16 <mflorea> it doesn't crash when the tabs are not displayed?  
17:19 <gdelhumeau> when I hide the iframe, I have no problem anymore  
17:20 <polx> has quit  
17:20 <mflorea> I'm referring to:  
17:20 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <mflorea> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor  
17:21 <AFKGeek> has quit  
17:21 <gdelhumeau> displayTabs: 'false'  
17:21 <gdelhumeau> it does not fix the issue  
17:23 <mflorea> so "it seems that the bad div is .gwt-TabPanelBottom" cannot be true  
17:23 <cjd> it's a combination of a lot of things  
17:23 <mflorea> I don't think there's any .gwt-TabPanelBottom when the tabs are not displayed  
17:24 <cjd> otherwise the bug would have been blatently obvious, even to microsoft techs  
17:43 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:48 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> Maybe I can disable the responsiveness for ie9  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> since it looks like a problem with media queries

18:57 <Enygma`> vmassol: sure, because XWiki is a collaboration tool :D  
18:58 <vmassol> I wish it were  
18:58 <vmassol> we would be able to collaborate on the same doc ;)  
18:58 <Enygma`> vmassol: ok, done. If the lock is still there, break it.
